page.title: 06SPECIAL PUB NAMES
page.content: Stapleford has some very interesting pub names. 'The Old Cross', is named after the old stone cross in St. Helen's churchyard, which used to be in middle of the High Street. The 'Warren Arms', is named after the Warren family. Sir John Borlase Warren and Lady Caroline Warren who devoted their lives to helping the community. 'The Happy Man', was named after Sir John Borlase Warren, who asked Lady Caroline to marry him. She agreed and made him a 'Happy Man'. So that is how it received it's name. 'The Sherwin Arms',was rebuilt in 1953 to make way for a highway:the A52 and B5010. Recently, 'The White Lion', was modernised. Both the Inns have had several owners.
